net.jadler.stubbing

Class StubResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jadler.stubbing.StubResponse

  • public class StubResponse
extends Object
    A definition of a stub http response. Defines the response status, encoding, body and headers as well as a delay the response will be returned after. Instances of this class are mutable so the stub response definition can be constructed on the fly. One should never create new instances of this class directly, see Jadler for explanation and tutorial.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StubResponse()
      Creates new empty stub http response definition.

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String name,
             String value)
        Adds a new header to this stub response. If there already exists a header with this name in this stub response, multiple values will be sent.
        Parameters:
        name - header name
        value - header value

      • addHeaders

        public void addHeaders(org.apache.commons.collections.MultiMap headers)
        Adds headers to this stub response. If there already exists a header with a same name in this stub response, multiple values will be sent.
        Parameters:
        headers - response headers (both keys and values must be of type String)

      • setHeaderCaseInsensitive

        public void setHeaderCaseInsensitive(String name,
                            String value)
        Removes all occurrences of the given header in this stub response (using a case insensitive search) and sets its single value.
        Parameters:
        name - header name
        value - header value

        public long getDelay()
        Returns:
        a delay (in millis) this stub response will be returned after
